review: Great early morning breakfast choice after a way to early flight in from Waco. Beth was providing friendly and attentive service while taking care of the bar. My cup of coffee stayed filled. The steak and eggs with bacon were really good. Seasoned just right. No salt and pepper required. The whole grain toast was quite tasty too. The steak was cooked to my liking and hit the spot. The bacon was crispier than I prefer but not too crisp. Can't complain. I usually find TGI Fridays to be a safe food choice at airports but this one had outstanding customer service for an airport.

25 minutes!!! That's how long I was sitting there and still NO sign of my server! Several other servers noticed me sitting there and asked if I'd ordered and it only took 10+ minutes for the manager to come by to take my drink order. At 15 min the squirrelly little server finally dropped off my drinks without ANY apology, without noticing how upset I was, and without taking my order. Another TEN MINUTES passed with me staring as my "server" waited at every other table - including people who were seated after me.  I am a frequent business traveler and USED to frequent this establishment but no more. I've deleted my Friday's app and will NOT be back!

Being at DFW airport for a while before our flights we were in search of a decent place to eat and grab a glass of wine when we saw a listing for TGI Friday's. Yay! I haven't been to this restaurant since my Hub's and I were in Japan. I love the consistency of this chain!  Although super busy we didn't have to wait for a table. The service here was really efficient (I guess you would have to be at the airport) both our server and the food were quick. Unfortunately our server didn't have much of a personality, but that is ok when everything else is firing on all cylinders.  I had the Sirloin with Jack Daniel's glaze. The glaze was awful and all over everything! I asked our server for a side plate and managed to scrape the glaze off my steak and put it on the side plate. Our server walked by about 10 times and didn't ask or say anything. Then a Manager came walking by (must have noticed the multiple plates in front of me) and stopped to ask what was happening with my situation. I told her and she immediately apologized and replaced all the side items without the sauce.  I would totally go back next time we are at DFW, just wouldn't order the same thing.  P.S. There is only 1 TGIF's at the airport and many terminals. It takes no time at all to transfer terminals on the tram.
Mix up on my order which kitchen compounded. Management immediately rectified problem & expedited correct order.  Burger was delicious.

Food it standard Fridays that is what I like you know what you will be getting. The service here at the airport has always been good every time I have stopped in. Location convent to Skylink so good location.

I haven't been to a TGI Fridays in years; not since like, the early 2000s or something like that. Imagine my surprise to discover that...yes...they do indeed serve breakfast. And a pretty decent one, I might add. At first, I considered ordering the traditional scrambled egg breakfast. Then I thought, "Screw it! Give me the artery clogging delectation known as the Ham & Bacon omelet! YOLO!" (okay, I didn't actually say "Yolo" out loud, but I was thinking it pretty hard) The omelet had a presentation I'm not used to seeing. It was flat. Literally. Like...the omelet was possibly the flattest omelet I ever laid eyes on. And even though the omelet was flatter than the plate it was resting on, it definitely didn't TASTE flat! The eggs were surprisingly well seasoned with a buttery aftertaste. The reason I say surprisingly is because normally these types of chain restaurants are scared of putting any seasoning in their menu items. But this...was a refreshing change of pace. Also got a side of homefries and they were...alright. Typical for a casual pub such as this. Oh, ya know these guys serve alcohol in the morning? Ch'yeah! Right off the bat, the waitress wanted to get my colleague and I drunk apparently. It wasn't even 9:00am yet. Now, I'm not opposed to the occasional mimosa with my breakfast. I just thought it was funny and unexpected. Only complaint I have for this location is the pricing of food. Breakfast really shouldn't be all that expensive unless we're eating, like, Chef Ramsay style food here. To put it another way, my side of homefries was $3 and they were average. Not great, but not terrible either. I just don't see why sides here are $3. I estimate my colleague paid about a dollar per slice of bacon he had.  The coffee was decent enough for what it was. All in all, I was surprised at the quality of food I got. Not a bad spot to visit if you happen to have a long enough layover to facilitate extended casual dining. Hey, it beats fast food, amirite? I'm giving TGI Fridays' breakfast: Airport Edition...4 happy hour beverages before noon out of 5.

This is a Friday's in DFW Airport, Terminal B. Right by the Skylink exit. There are not a load of sit down food options in Terminal B since that Terminal is still under major construction in certain areas so this is a good option if you're looking to sit down for a bit. This location is clean and quick. The rating is 3* which I believe is just like Yelp says - A-OK and that's what Friday's is, A-OK. The service is fast and the food is hot. There are plenty of servers so your drink will never be empty.  It would be nice if the location has more power ports or places to charge phones.

Very good and efficient! I asked to have a table with access to a plug and it's been offered without any problem. Smiling and very fast service. I had a grilled chicken slightly over cooked but still ok with their whisky glaze. It's been very pleasant to have well cooked vegetables! I'll visit them again !

I would give 4 stars for service, and 1 star for the food. I ordered the California Chicken Club sandwich, which was supposed to be grilled chicken, smoked Gouda, avocado, lettuce, bacon, aioli, and tomato on a baguette.  The sandwich smelled of bleach, and I narrowed it down to the bottom bun...it tasted weird and I ended up just removing it. I substituted truffle aioli for the normal one it was supposed to come with, and that was a mistake. The truffle aioli tasted strongly of chemicals...Anthony Bourdain would tell me it serves me right for ordering something with truffle oil in it (read Appetites...amazing!). The chicken was cold, and seemed old. It was crusted in some kind of red pepper flakes, and was rubbery and gross. The sandwich was topped with an unripe tomato and chopped romaine. The avocado was actually fine, and I scraped off the aioli and ate that with a fork. The bacon and Gouda were both cold.  I expected a freshly-grilled chicken breast with a melty slice of Gouda and warm crispy bacon, and I was super disappointed. If the menu indicated everything was cold, it wouldn't have been such a shock. Or the chef needs to actually cook things to order like a normal restaurant.  Super disappointing. But the waiter was attentive, and there's a Red Mango across the hall. So there ya go.

This place has more seats than most of the restaurants in the airport and it was comfortable to spend a couple of hours when my flight got delayed. Nice staff, good food and drinks, so I'd recommend it if you're stuck at the airport!  They also let a woman charge her phone from an outlet in the waitstaff area which was something nice to see.
Their take on their own Jack Daniel's chicken was bad. Definitely could have made a better dish at home.

Delicious stop while waiting for your flight. This place is a standard TGIF.  I had a tasty Jack Daniels burger with a side salad.  Overall, we spent about 40 minutes on our meal.  Not too bad before our flight and much better than waiting in the gate area. I liked that the restaurant had small, credit card scanners that they brought to the table.  Prices were also not overly expensive for airport food.

I feel that when you rate a place you rate it compared to its equals - not a shack on the side of the road compared to a 5 star steak house.  That being said - this TGI Fridays was above and beyond my expectations. I arrived about 2 hours early for my flight like a good little girl and the security line looked line the line up for my hand in marriage - noneski. So I breezed through without even a pause in my step. First thing I see off the security area in B terminal is TGI Fridays. Ok why not .. I have nearly a hour and half to spare and have not had dinner. Jen in the bar is awesome. Super friendly and kept checking in on me during my meal. I started with a Sangria Rita which was strong but not to my taste because I don't care for red wine but still good. I did he sizzling chicken and cheese which was very moist and tender. The potatoes could have a bit of improvement as they looked kind of processed but still tasted good.  I then did the whiskey cake and peach sangria for dessert - I had a long time to wait, ok?! The sangria was delicious and whiskey cake was pretty good. Not as good as the one from the Restaurant, Whiskey Cake but still good.  Overall, great and friendly experience - Jen is awesome and food was really good.

So disappointing. I had a 2 hour layover and stopped for a meal. Burger came out terrible. Fried onions were soggy. Buns were so chewy I had to tear apart my burger and salvage what's edible. Water tasted like it came from the tap. I'm still Hungry... Not very happy. The 2 stars for the prompted service.
Breakfast tacos were very good and service from Chase was fast but man I paid $11 for a mimosa .. Definitely didn't think that through or notice until bill came.  But it came with a strawberry .

This TGI Fridays had decent food for an airport restaurant at an expectedly high price. I ordered the chicken caprese salad to-go and it was a sizable portion, but the quality wasn't amazing. It did satisfy me amidst a long day of travel, but in terms of the food itself, the chicken was pretty dry and old, and the flavors were not great. It was a decent variety of ingredients for a salad, unlike the unfortunate salads which basically only have lettuce, but nothing seemed super fresh. Overall, this was a quick, alright meal but nothing spectacular.

Has the grilled Chicken Cobb salad The staff was great the food was ok, very typical Friday's ... It is what it is  The salad was pretty boring only high point was that it was a fair amount of chicken

As far as airport food goes, I give Friday's breakfast a business class rating (1st class - economy ;). The southwestern omelette was made with real eggs, fresh onion and bell pepper, and was accompanied by lightly buttered wheat toast. It was hot, fresh, and ready in less than 5 minutes. They are tops in terminal B for breakfast!

I ordered the steak and egg first off they only have scrambled eggs second I ordered the steak med rare it was rare but it had a strong blood taste which tells me was old meat, rare steak doesn't have a blood taste especially a strong one. The waiter never asked how my meal was or why I left my steak on the plate.
Service was fine, food was very bland. Ate a chicken quesadilla and it had absolutely no flavor. Would not recommend stopping here to eat.

As far as chain-restaurants go, especially in airports, this location isn't too shabby.. but it is quintessentially still airport food. I had missed a connecting flight because the first flight was tardy and the second left early (argh AA!), so I had some time to kill before the next flight I was hoping to board left. Service was very efficient and friendly, with the manager even coming around to check on the food and service.  French toast (kid's size): ( ) The French toast here was surprisingly.. decent. It doesn't cross the border into some of the best I've had, but I've definitely had worse, and it came out piping hot with a good amount of egginess. Plus the kid's size was just right, both in pricing and in portion.  Veggie omelet with whole wheat toast: ( ) Maybe I shouldn't have opted for the veggie option, but I wasn't feeling too carnivorous after a red-eye, so I thought vegetables would settle more easily. My biggest gripe with the omelet was how much butter went into it and how in-your-face obvious the butter taste was. It was just too much to stomach, and I barely took a few bites before deeming it a lost cause. The vegetables inside were fine for the most part, except that I'd never had broccoli in a veggie omelet before and it was a little strange in texture. I probably would have just preferred some onions or tomatoes instead of the broccoli and bell peppers that dominated. The overall omelet definitely came off as more of a scramble.. or an interpretive art form version of an omelet.  To me, airport restaurants are in a sector of their own, and TGI Friday's earns a "not bad" in my book. At least the food was hot, the service friendly, and the prices not outrageous.

What a great place to stop in at while your waiting on your flight! They have a breakfast menu as well as their regular menu!  The host was amazing and checked on me a few times as I visited! Loved the fact the bartender took the time to come out and check on me to ask how my drink was and even the host came back out after my food arrived to ask me how everything was! Totally was not expected that! This will be my pit spot from here on out!

Stopped here first my layover. I was seated automatically and the greater was actually friendly. Chill ambiance. Good music. My waiter was courteous as well. Ordered just the TGI Friday shrimp with fries. Both were very hot. The fries were perfectly seasoned with salt and pepper. No need to adjust! Lol Shrimp was perfectly battered. And one of the best strawberry lemonade I've had in a long time. They are doing good
Good shrimp, but the worst ribeye I have ever had! It was like shoe leather - I was vary disappointed. Ok ok the shrimp was good- i was at the restaurant in the airport in Texas

This Friday's is very busy. You do have to wait in line to be seated but less than 5 minutes. Toko the waitress gave me outstanding attention. She was very personable and it was quit busy and she still was attentative to all she waited on.  My bbq chicken flat bread pizza was very flavorful. The pumpkin spiced  martini are very different and it's perfect for the holiday.

Early morning breakfast between flights at TGI-Fridays? Yes! Great, friendly service. Quick turn around and pretty good French toast and good hot coffee. Our server Daniel was awesome, attentive, and helpful

OMG nothing saids "home" like eating at TGI Friday's after a week vacation in Hondouras. I actually never dined at TGI Fridays prior but I was so grateful when we landed at the Dallas Int'l Airport in Texas for a layover, LOL. All of my 20+ friends ordered burgers, fries and beer. I LOVED my Sedona Black Bean Veggie Burger....it had chipotle mayo, melted Monterey Jack and cheddar, balsamic-glazed onions and sliced avocado. I got half/half sweet potato and regular fries. Yummmm. I thoroughly enjoyed myself and on behalf of all of my friends....we were all glad to be "home."

Good place to eat in DFW airport.  We've been there a handful of times. Basic chain restaurant menu items. Great for families or traveling business folk. Service is pretty quick. Waitstaff is very competent and capable.

I know this is an airport location... but come on. Service is service. And there is a huge lack of good service here. My waiter expected me to order right after bringing my drink. I wasn't ready. Asked for a couple of minutes. Didn't see my waiter for the next 10-15 minutes... I got up and left...
Soggy fries  and greasy Jack Daniel burger .  Fast service and the servers fixed the fries for me.
Got stuck in the dfw airport due to weather   Service is good and fast steak is airport quality. I know better so it's my fault

This review is for the locatin at DFW 4E-Gate17. I came here to grab a quick bite before boarding my flight and the server Yesi was the best! The food tastes OK- no big surprises there- but the reason why this review got 4 stars instead than 3 is the personnel. Way to go!

Ordered a $21 rib eye steak and received I'm not sure what tough slab of meat that seemed more of a rump roast texture and flavor.  You would think that a Texas restaurant would know their beef cuts.  My companion had a chicken Cobb salad with dry overcooked chicken.  I gave it two stars simply because the server did his job with a smile and made sure we received our meal promptly before our connecting flight.

Very convenient! If you have a couple of hours or more to spare. It's nice just to relax and enjoy a meal. First, I am not a fan of these franchise restaurants especially TGIF. Food is never cooked right and always to salty. But this is not a bad place if you just want a burger. So I had a burger and fries. Burger was surprisingly cooked exactly how I wanted, medium well. So I really enjoyed this meal. Service was OK, plenty of workers came by to make sure I was taken care of except my waitress? The price, well its in the airport. So it's higher than usual. Again, very convenient and a very food place if you time to waist.
Jason was great!! Fast food and great service. You can't beat $10 unlimited appetizers

My server quickly arrived at my table. It was an extremely busy Friday evening just outside the C29 terminal. My server offered me a selection of drink options. When we happened upon iced tea, my eyes flashed. I abruptly blurted out the question, "Oh!! Sweet Tea?" She could clearly see my expectant face. Without missing a beat, she cheerfully offered "I can make sure it is."  Please understand that on the day of my visit, I had been awake since 4 AM. To be offered such inventive and welcome problem solving is nigh on a godsend.  For my appetizer, I elected the mozzarella sticks. The hot marinara really worked well with the sticks and I quickly drained my first tub. Again, without missing a beat, my server offered me a refill (which I initially rejected as I though I didn't want / need it). It was not 2 minutes later, but she saw me scooping out the remnants of my first serving. This time, she asked if I was sure (about not wanting more marinara). Despite my embarrassment, I relented and happily accepted a refill.  At every point during my meal, I felt well cared for (without ever being made to feel rushed or harried). Everyone takes the time to complain. I wanted very much to take the time and sing the high praise for this location and my saving grace: my server.  My wife and I had a good laugh about it later on the phone (she is only TOO aware how much I crave good service). If ever I should find myself in C-29 again, I will not hesitate to make a bee line for this TGI Fridays! Travel well, my friends!

Ok, it's the airport and a chain, but I had a pecan chicken salad with good lettuce,  cranberry,  blue cheese and other stuff.   Raspberry vinnegrette.  Overall it was decent with very friendly service.  I would stop again when traveling through  dfw and wo u ld recommend to other travelers.  This was my first time at  a this chain.

We found this restaurant in the Airport and were not expecting too much. We like TGIFs in general, but the Airport is not a plus for most restaurants. That said, the food was just as good as usual, as were the prices. The service was at least as good, and perhaps better, than we expect. All in all this was a surprise for the Airport. Much better than most Airport restaurants!

We had breakfast here as I have had before.  This time was no different.  The breakfast is of acceptable quality.  I had a meat and cheese omelet with toast and coffee.  The price is right too when you consider most places in the airport gauge the crap out of you.  I found TGIFriday's to be consistent in service and quality and we pretty much rely on them for breakfast or lunch in between flights.

I get that airport food is not great, but this ranks as one of the worst experiences I've had in recent memory. The food was clearly reheated from crappy frozen (but not hot). I got three hard, cold, tortellini with my Parmesan chicken and some old tomato salad. If I wasn't really hungry I wouldn't eat it. My bf's burger was gray and overcooked with a cold bun. The service was fine but not great. We honestly regret not just going to McDonald's. It was a waste of money. Avoid!
Had two different appetizers - chips were VERY salty.  Very.  Not a bad for a quick in-between flights meal but definitely not somewhere I would make a point to return to.

Horrible Service. Not to many people in this place and still managed to take forever to get 2 waters and a beer.  We even seen people around being served and had to waive her down. Kari asked us if we wanted the appetizer first and we said yes, but that didn't happen.  Fries were old, but the rest was good. That's why I put 2 stars. We get the bill and waited for our change,, nope stood around waiting, asked people to get our server and host came out with our change as he rolled his eyes. Never seen Kari Again!

Love when pilots said they made up time on our flight   Seems like they could do this all the time.  With our extra time on the layover, we went to TGIF's  Seated quickly and the food was out within 15 minutes   Had two kids who were whining at everything, so the food was my savior.  Overall decent food and the service was quick.

For travelers with food allergies, there aren't many options to choose from when considering airport dining. Thankfully, TGI Friday's has a separate menu for anyone allergic to nuts, dairy, soy, or gluten.  In the airy, open space on Concourse B, I enjoyed a small steak, cooked medium rare, mashed potatoes, and steamed broccoli, along with a bourbon and soda. The food, while not terribly exciting, was cooked well, and left me sated. Best of all, the bill came to just over twenty bucks. The staff is super-efficient, and generally polite. (The greeters seem to have the most personality, but I'm guessing working at DFW can be a drag.)

I was actually on break from my trip before taking flight again. I came here with my pilots to eat breakfast, which Had no idea TGI Friday's had! I guess it's a Texas thing. I had the 3 breakfast tacos with pico de gallo on the side. Yummy yummy for the tummy!

My experience here was most excellent. I had the pot stickers for staters and a combo for the entree which was chicken and a 6 ounce steak. The food was fantastic, hot, great quality and the flavors were really good, it was out fast, and the server (Justin) was attentive without being annoying, and ensured I was being well looked after. Highly recommended!

It's a typical airport restaurant.  Limited menu, no real silverware, and higher prices.  Depending on the time of the day, there is usally a wait. Not a bad place to have a drink and pass some time though.

Terrible service! I mean really, really terrible service. The food was normal T.G.I Friday food-below average and over priced. I waited for drinks, was served starter and meal at the same time and waited and waited and waited to pay and the place was not busy during my visit.

had a three hour layover on my flight to SEA  4/20/2013 was greeted at the front and seated. I am a single business traveler. I sat there for over 10 minutes and no service the place was not busy at 3pm so I walked out and told the girl who sat me all she said was sorry I had money to spend and could not spend it there. All young staff have on idea about customer service.

Food was great.  Service and service alone gets this rating. Our server, Nelson, either is having a really bad day, or is the worst server in TGI Friday history.  When he took our order, my wife asked for a pack of crackers because she felt a bit uneasy from the previous flight.  We never saw him again.  When someone else delivered our food...The order was wrong.  I watched my wife eat her dinner as I waited for my correct order to arrive. Shortly after she finished,  my burger finally showed.  Nelson never came by to see if it was ok...nada.  He finally appoligized when he surfaced to deliver the check.  Needless to say, Nelson ' s tip equalled his service...NADA!  I hate not tipping, and really contemplated doing so, but in this case tipping would have validated his attempt at service...Couldn't do it.  On behalf of the cooks, the burger once received was great.

First off, totally weird that I am reviewing a TGI Friday's. Even weirder? That I am reviewing the TGIF Fridays in Concourse C of DFW airport. I wish I had my waiter's name, because he was easily the best waiter I've ever had in any airport ever! I sat down for lunch and a beer while waiting for a flight. When he approached me he asked where I was traveling; I replied with "Nashville." He then told I had about an hour until that flight boarded, just enough to eat and maybe have a beer or two (I opted for just one beer.) After taking my order, he greeted the table next to me and asked where they were traveling to. When they said, "Boston," he knew exactly how much time they had to sit and eat until their flight boarded. Amaze-balls. I'm always surprised when eateries in the airport seem to have no idea that people could be in a hurry to get somewhere. *cough* Baltimore McDonald's *cough* So I give major kuddos to this waiter who has seemed to memorize all the flight schedules and helps passengers get on their way after eating and/or drinking. (Proactively bringing the check? Thank you!) It's still a TGI Fridays and in an airport, so it's hard to give this place 5 stars. However, when traveling through DFW, I will definitely be stopping at this TGI Fridays again.

Hmmm.  We have to eat cuz we've got an 8 hr flight.   Shouldn't have eaten here tho !   My ' rare' ribeye was well done.  Sharis burger did not have a good flavor.  Server was excellent, and we tipped her well !!  Avoid !
Served uneatable chicken, agreed it was, then wanted to charge for the meal. Two bites were taken out of the  dish. Employees don't seam to care or pay attention. Sad.

It's TGI Friday's in an airport... obviously I didn't expect much, but they found a way to disappoint nonetheless. We ordered full meals and salads to start. It took 10-15 minutes to receive the salads. 30 seconds later, our entrees were delivered. The waitress joked about not having room on the table to fit them because our salad plates were taking up most of the hightop table. Regardless, she chose to charge us for both of the salads that we never had the chance to eat. The food was about as bad as anything I've ever had at a chain restaurant. The ribs were chewy and and dried out. Even the fries were gross... undercooked and soggy. If you find yourself stuck in Terminal C at DFW, just suck it up and walk 5 minutes to Terminal D where they have actual food options worthy of your time and money.

We ended up not eating here because we went to a different place but I am leaving a 5 star review just for the AMAZING service we received at the stool seating across from the bar. I wish I could remember his name!!! Taller fellow, 40-50 year-old... you rocked our 20 minute stay in this restaurant while we had our beed with your knowledgeable conversation and amazing costumer service.
Had the breakfast tacos and loved them. Good service and a friendly waiter. Food was hot and really better than expected. I recommend if you happen to be in Terminal B in the morning.

As chain restaurants in airports go it was ok. Not bad. Not memorable. What was memorable was the bartender that called me "sweetie" darlin" "honey" etc. multiple times. Nice guy but someone needs to explain to him that personal references to someone without knowing them personally can be offensive. If it were once or twice I would have overlooked it, but it was every time he addressed me. It became totally annoying and offensive. There. Done with my rant.
Hungry in the morning for more than breakfast. This is the place. Coming from EST. I was able to get fresh ribs and shrimp JD style and was not old or dry. Good service and location in D terminal

Between flights, we had a chance to have lunch here.  I really do not like the quality of what's offered in any Airport--you get what you get! We've found that TGI Friday's at DFW Airport is about the best there is. I ordered the Jim Beam Chicken Sandwich with fries. It's always good and better than the other fast food places. We'll be back here in the future and will have lunch here again. Far superior than what is currently served on the airlines. Oh for the days past when airlines served good food that was included in the airfare!

Definitely A-Ok. Had their chicken tender which took 15 minutes to get done and it wasn't all that great. Pricey, but what do you expect from airport food? Otherwise, conveniently located next to the terminals so you can sit there and eat until they call you. There's also a quick order area for you to order to go which I did so I could eat on the plane. There's no mention anywhere else and in case it wasn't clear from my review, this is located inside the Dallas Fort Worth airport.

On a layover from Reno to Dallas.  Ordered Chicken Tortilla soup.  With a Cherrry lime-aid slush.  The soup was good but the slick was just juice with ice.  I traded it in for an iced tea.  The boyfriend has a cheese burger which was average an over sales fries.  Service was great.

This worked! I give it three stars because it was an overpriced airport restaurant. Compared to its peers, you can't go wrong. I'd go again in a heart beat but only because of the TSA endured monopoly. I asked for water and as busy as the waitress was, it was always full. And the manager even came by to actually help. The manager helping out? Unheard of in an airport restaurant. 3 stars is well deserved but I would go here in a heartbeat again when in the airport.

Ordered cheese burger and fries and got a piece of straight blonde hair in my burger.  I know it's not my hair because my hair is black and curly. Asked for manager and informed that in the food service business hair hygiene is a must. He brought out new burger quickly!

They treat u well.  I only had a few minutes while I was on my way to my gate, but well worth it.  The bartender immediately wants to help u. And he did. Shot of patron and a beer.  Killed it and headed out to my gate.

Pretty good for airport food . It tasted fresh for the most part . The service is good . And if you need to they can get you in and out quick   I got the chicken it was not dry ,or tasted like it was fake . I would come here again .

Had a cheeseburger and it was quite tasty. Service was a bit lackluster. I didn't like the loud escalator running right beside me (made conversation hard), especially since it didn't serve anything (the access to the shuttle was closed). Seems kind of weird to have an escalator in the middle of a working restaurant.

Stuck on a 4 hour layover at 530am so decided to get some real breakfast.  Ordered small French toast with sides of eggs and potatoes. The French toast wasn't bad, and the eggs were undercooked, but the potatoes had to be leftovers from the day before... They were extremely hard and crunchy, with no soft center at all, as if they were dumped in the deep frier for a second or third time.  The service was acceptable, but this little sit down certainly didn't have the desired effect of pulling me out of my post red-eye grumpy mood.  Music also annoyingly too loud for 530am... I really am grumpy, lol!  Will skip this place for breakfast in the future.

Awesome service and quality food. This beats out any airport dinning experience I've ever had. Unfortunately, this was the only full service restaurant (that I saw) in Terminal C so they were overcrowded. In order to get a seat, I had to hover over the bar, kinda like a seat stalker, in order to get first dibs on opening seats. The tactic worked and I didnt have to wait long.  The bar is equipped with plugs for your electronics (yes PLUGS for my dying iPhone) and wifi is available.  The food and drinks were comparable to any other Friday's and I left satisfied. This was an awesome stop before my flight and when in the area, I will visit again.  PS - steer clear of the avocado salad dressing :-|

With two hours of sleep, an early morning flight and while it was still dark, as I was waiting for my plane to Miami, it seemed only appropriate to have a glass of wine.   "This is gonna sound bad, but can I get a glass of wine?"  I asked the greeters at 6:53am.    "Yes! You have 7 minutes."  "Yeah!" The sound of my inner surfer frat dude leaked out. They laughed.  "Hey I'm on vacation!"  I quipped. With a cupcake Pinot for $7, it wasn't at all bad especially for an airport, but being calorie conscious, and with some entrees, somewhat laughably, being noted as  "under 750 calories", I had to forgo food. I was about to hit the beach. Luckily this place is kind of dark with lots of big screen TVs, even at 7am. I had two glasses of wine, and I made my flight. Thank you Friday.
Very nice place for an airport restaurant/snack bar. Good food, good prices. I lucked out and ate there when the airport wasn't totall overwhelmed, and it was pretty pleasant.

Being down south reminds you of how a person should be treated. Received great service from the beginning.  Drinks and food were on point. My waitor Justin was very helpful and accommodating.  He was the reason that I had a great experience here at TGI Fridays which I typically don't encounter.
Best restaurant in Terminal B. Don't go anywhere else. I was stranded there for a day trust me.
Food was awesome and quick....bartender was terrible with only 3 people at the bar! She kept going to the back I never got my drink...would not recommend stopping here

Not too bad of an airport restaurant. They don't have the full normal TGI Fridays menu and there tends to be a wait, but the people are pretty friendly. The beer selection is a little odd, some of the normal things that the other bars/restaurants have that you might expect they don't. Food came out pretty quickly. Not too bad of a choice if you're in the area.
Small but a good spot to grab a bite or drink between travels. Wish they had USB chargers at the bar for phones! !!!!

Stopped in here when heading to Mexico and essentially my last American food for a week. I had the bonesless chicken in the Bbq sauce and the spinach flat bread. I thought they could have added more cheese and cooked it a little less to prevent it from being a little to dry for my pallet.  The bonesless chicken chunks were filling as i needed something to fill me for the flight.

Not bad if you're in a hurry. Honestly it's subpar compared to other TGI's, but let's be real: it's in an airport.  The pros 1. Quick 2. Staff is friendly The cons 1. Not too tasty 2. Crowded all the time.

Great location for AA gates in the 30s.  Food is well made and high quality - enjoyed the Parmesan chicken and the tasty sweet potato fries w the jack Daniels bacon chicken sandwich, all perfectly seasoned and well made - great stop before or after a flight  Thanks Dawn for the great cart and service!

I am a bit disappointed as this is my second trip to this TGI Fridays. Service began well. I was able to order my food and drink within a minute of being seated. After 25 minutes of waiting, the waitress finally stopped by my table to let me know they were working on my food. At this point I started to notice people who ordered after me getting their food. normally I wouldn't mind much if I was not in a rush, but after 40 minutes of waiting for a cheeseburger I could clearly see something was not right here.  The Waitress seemed to not know what was taking so long for my food, which makes me think she either forgot to put my order in or the cook misplaced the order. After almost 45 minutes of waiting, the waitress brought out my food in a to-go box. The food was good and would be normally what I would expect from Friday's. However the service was under par. I would not recommend going here if you are flying out within 1 hour of being seated. You might be cutting it close.

I have been to many tgif, surprisingly I ordered the chicken with spinach, recommended by my waiter, I really enjoyed the meal, spinach was fresh chicken was tender and tasty to my surprise bring in an airport..definitely a good deal.
For an airport restaurant, its huge. Beer was a little pricey, but the service was great. Got to watch the Horns lay the smack down on UCLA. Hook Em'.

Saturday afternoon, 4:40pm.  Hungry travelers trying to get food.  TGI is CLOSED!! Could not believe it.  You can't get stars if you are not open to serve food. Who ever heard of closing at 4:30 when airplanes are still flying.  I saw about 30 people try to get in.

Usual sodium laden rubbish , but with rude and indifferent service. Not an easy trifecta of crap , but well done here. Bad  service   Bad food.  I was stuck needing to eat at the airport, so didn't expect much.  But the food was greasy.

Great job by the staff to handle a lot of people but still get the food out quickly and keep the drinks full. It may not be fancy but it dang sure hit the spot! Props to Justin for a great job as our server! Friday's isn't your local watering hole but they really do maintain a consistent level of quality that is easy to appreciate when you are hungry!

The area is under construction. The restaurant is cold. Since I was in a wheel chair, we were seated where we couldn't see the bar or other patrons or servers. I ordered "a hamburger, no cheese, no butter, no toasting of the bread. Don't toast my bread. I can't eat dairy and don't toast my bread." Waiter brings burger on open, toasted bun and other order, quickly placed everything and left. I picked my plate up, made my way around into civilization, found my server, and asked, again, for "a burger, no cheese, no butter, no toasting of the bread. Don't toast my bread.I can't eat dairy, and don't toast my bread." He takes my plate and returns a few minutes later with the same plate, swapped bun for a fresh one, but buttered. I told him it looked buttered. He argued. I told him to "take it back and bring something not buttered". Manager returned with the same bun. We looked at it together and agreed it has butter. He brought me sliced oatmeal bread (which has very different texture from hamburger bun). The fries were long since cold by this point, but I had to tell the waiter to bring out hot ones. They arrived warm at best. This place is not prepared to deal with special needs. And it is a long way from a bathroom, too.
Typical Friday's fare, good service and a couple of plugs throughout the restaurant if you need to plug in a laptop.  You can access the tmobile wifi from this location.

Hmm, this was certainly a let down. The food was boring, I had the chicken and cheese dinner, and the prices were ridiculous. I paid over $20 for lunch. I realize this was in an airport but come on, that's terrible. The atmosphere was crazy and certainly not one I would return to. Probably the only reason that I am giving them a two stars is because the service was good, she was prompt and tentative.
Airport fare. Quick and easy, nothing special.

My cousin left our home in San Antonio to travel back to Wisconsin and found out that her cash card had wrongly been cancelled. Her company was rushing a new one to her, but that did not help her on her trip today! Her sister offered to pay at TGIF long-distance with a credit card, but the manager at TGIF insisted on picking up the tab for my cousin and her 7 y/o son. We are so appreciative and grateful that they did not have to go all day without eating. We will patronize TGIF any time. Thank you all SO MUCH!

The food was the same as any other TGIF. The waiters were a bit inappropriate, like the customers weren't standing in front of them. It was odd, really. There was truly not much to say about this place. I ordered the Jack Daniel's Burger, and it was just as good as it is at other TGI Friday's. The wait for my to-go food was around ten minutes.

Great experience. The service operated smoothly and quickly. My server Brandon was very kind and not too pushy. I had the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich and a Caesar side salad. Their Caesar is an interesting flavor, a bit more lemony than most. I liked it! All my food tasted great! Definitely would return here.

Ordered a Chicken Quesada. It literally had 3 pieces of chicken in it. Sent it back. Manager apologized and ensured me it would be done right. Second one arrived. Same thing. Showed manager. Made excuses though agreeing it wasn't up to TGIFs standard. Left hungry. These are just the facts. I'll let you form your own opinion.

This has to absolutely be the highlight of my trip to Dallas! Flying in from DC, and emptied stomach was tragedy! LOL My family and i ate here and all i could remember was the superior service our server Chris gave! He was awesome! The TGIF's in DC is horrible! The service just is horric! Chris was a cool guy, with a southern charm! He was so nice! I wish i could have tipped him more, but unfortunately my cousin's wedding broke my ass! LOL but i wanted to give this review because people like Chris need the recognition!

This review is on their Caesar salad only. It's your typical salad. Though, I did notice that the chicken is more fresh than most. Usually when I purchase salad-to-go, the chicken looks like blocks, looks like it is not fresh, and maybe a bit old? This salad looked fresher than most, and one I'd eat again.
Very nice and quick appetizer in dallas terminal airport , had the bonless buffalo wings and it was so yummy also 5 stars to the customer service very nice and helpfull.
Always a great place to stop whether it is an early morning flight or late night.  The staff is always nice and I've never had to send any food back, they are always spot on as far as a chain goes.

Got a spinach flatbread before my flight. The portion was on the small side and the flavors were only ok. I got it to-go so I don't know how the service usually is, but the hostess was a little rude to me.

If you ever have time on your layover, and need to grab a bite, I would highly recommend trying this TGIF.  Service was very fast and friendly to say the least, and the food is what you would expect from a TGIF.  What really sold me on this place was the staff.  They were very friendly, great guys, fun and easy to talk to and joke around with.  Made my experience there very positive.
I have been to this place many times fast cheap and good food.

Was pleasantly surprised while in Terminal C.  Waitress was quick and friendly.  Attentive and fast with the drink refills and checking up.  Would definitely eat here again.  Are there two TGIFs in C?  Could have sworn I walked by one on my way to C2.

This is my first negative review on Yelp (mainly because bad restaurants don't have Yelp pages).  Due to the inelastic demand of a hotel bar/restaurant I guess they feel that they can do whatever they want towards their customers.  We had an hour to kill before our flight and decided to stop and get some drinks and dinner.  Our waitress was incredibly slow and was unhelpful when it came to ordering withou

Airport restaurants need to be aware that many of us are connecting. On a slow Sunday morning it took 12 minutes to take a drink order. Given a dinner menu and had to ask for the breakfast menu at 10:00 am Sunday. Food is good (except my cream cheese for my bagel had black crumbs on it from inattentive serving.

We arrived back to the airport with a fair amount of time to kill before our flight so we decided to hit up Fridays.  Our waitress was super nice and didn't seem to mind that we were there for quite some time.  The food was standard Friday's food, you always know what you're going to get.

My family and I ate here. We had a layover so we decided to eat. The only thing i didn't like was the number of selections being an airport understandable. Our server i believe his name was Justin was outstanding. Very courteous, attentive just splendid. The food was good also.

The food was good.. The Tennessee Whisky Cake was great!!! Candace the waitress was friendly... I'll remember this spot every time I'm stuck at the Dallas Airport... Probably the only good memory about this airport..lol
Ask for Cajun service is great he always has  a good story
